questions.question: What is the trend sales in gift shop A from Jan to Dec?
What is the trend of the average price of books from 1960 to 2020 in city Z?
The residents of town Y are voting on a favorite hiking trail, and half of the votes have been counted. The poll closes on Sep 01, 2022. Which of the following is true?
options: Hiking trail A will be voted as the favorite trail.
Hiking trail B will be voted as the favorite trail.
Hiking trail C will be voted as the favorite trail.
questions.wrong_due_to_misleader: Hiking trail A will be voted as the favorite trail.

questions.question: Assuming today is May 01, and half of the votes from each state for a favorite ice cream brand have been counted. The color of each state corresponds to the brand that has received the most votes in that state so far. The brand with the most number of colored states will be the most popular brand, and the results will be finalized on May 15. Which of the folowing is true?
options: A will be most popular brand of ice cream.
B will be least popular brand of ice cream.
C will be the most popular brand of ice cream.
questions.wrong_due_to_misleader: A will be most popular brand of ice cream.

questions.question: If the temperature gets higher than 100 degree Fahrenheit, then the bottles of water sold must be greater than 750.
Within each town, is there a negative relationship between average daily working hours and happiness score?
Assuming today is Feb 20, 2022, which of the following is true about the vegetables planted by the three farms?
options: All three farms planted more vegetables in 2022 than they did in the previous years.
All three farms planted fewer vegetables in 2022 than they did in the previous years.
All three farms planted about the same amount of vegetables in 2022 as they did in the previous years.
questions.wrong_due_to_misleader: All three farms planted fewer vegetables in 2022 than they did in previous years.

questions.question: Assuming today is Apr 10, 2022, did the total number of cars parked in the three parking lots fall sharply in 2022?
Within each city, is there a positive relationship between salary and average daily working hours?
Assuming today is May 01, 2022, which of the following statements is true?
options: Company Z had more new employees in 2018 than in 2020.
The number of new employees per year fell sharply in 2022.
The total number of employees in company Z decreased in 2022.
questions.wrong_due_to_misleader: The number of new employees per year fell sharply in 2022.

questions.question: Company A sells a board game. Assuming today is June 01, 2022, which of the following statements is true?
options: Copies sold per year fell sharply in 2022.
Copies sold per year has been strictly increasing since 2003.
questions.wrong_due_to_misleader: Copied sold per year fell sharply in 2022.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about the prevalence of the plant species Y?
options: It is more prevalent in region D than in E.
It is less prevalent in region B than in C.
It is more prevalent in region C than in A.
It is less prevalent in region C than in D.
questions.correct_answer: It is less prevalent in region C than in D.
questions.wrong_due_to_misleader: It is more prevalent in region C than in A.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about the three brands of shampoo in city Y from 2001 to 2005?
options: The market share of brand C is on an increasing trend from 2001 to 2005.
The market share of brand C is higher in 2001 than in 2002.
Brand B had the largest market share in 2001 compared to its market share in the other years.
questions.correct_answer: The market share of brand C is higher in 2001 than in 2002.
questions.Task: Find Correlations/Trends, Make Comparisons, Find Extremum
questions.wrong_due_to_misleader: The market share of brand C is on an increasing trend from 2001 to 2005., Brand B had the largest market share in 2001 compared to its market share in the other years.

questions.question: Assuming today is May 10 and given the chart below, which statement about rainfall (mm) is true for the past 14 days?
options: The amount of rainfall peaked at the end of the past 14 days.
There was more rainfall at the beginning than at the end of the past 14 days.
None of the days had lower than 40mm of rainfall.
The amount of rainfall peaked at the beginning of the past 14 days.
questions.correct_answer: There was more rainfall at the beginning than at the end of the past 14 days.
questions.wrong_due_to_misleader: The amount of rainfall peaked at the end of the past 14 days.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about the annual number of new movies released in city X?
options: There were more new movies released in 1992 than in 1994.
2000 had the most number of new movies released.
There were more new movies released in 1996 than in 1995.
questions.correct_answer: There were more new movies released in 1992 than in 1994.
questions.Misleader: Manipulation of Scales - Unconventional Scale Directions
questions.wrong_due_to_misleader: 2000 had the most number of new movies released., There were more new movies released in 1996 than in 1995.

questions.question: Which of the following is true about company Z?
options: More employees have vacation days at D than those at A.
More employees have a satisfaction rating at B than those who have a rating at C.
Employee satisfaction rating decreases as the annual number of vacation days increases.
questions.correct_answer: More employees have vacation days at D than those at A.
questions.Misleader: Manipulation of Scales - Unconventional Scale Directions
questions.wrong_due_to_misleader: More employees have a satisfaction rating at B than those who have a rating at C.
